"i recently went through a divorce with my ex wife. she's the only person i knew and loved, and i've been struggling with depression, and i recently stumbled across as song called ""gloomy sunday,"" a song about a person about to kill himself, and i had my first suicidal thought ever. i used to be a really positive person. happy, optimistic. although my ex wife had a lot of mental health problems that wore on me to the point i adopted a more pessimistic outlook on life. when we separated, my depressive thoughts remained, and now that i had a thought of killing myself, im really scared. i dont know what to do, i just want to get better. my therapist doesn't seem to be helping that much. any assistance would be appreciated"

"i havent tried new medications for my anxiety and depression since i was in highschool due to horrible experiences. my provider wants me to try lexapro or zoloft. i am tired of continuously ruining my chances of a better future but i am terrified. i dont know what to expect. im scared of bad side effects. im scared ill get worse or i wont know if its helping. i know i want to change, i hope all of these years i havent ruined my chances at being a normal happy person. i dont know what its like to experience joy or show emotion other than sadness or anxiety or irritability. i dont know who i am, this has been my entire life, this is all i really know. im scared"

"i've accepted tnat i will never feel better. i <e1>dont have the courage to kill myself</e1>, so i just <e2>try to allow myself to live with the endless sadness</e2>. <e3>eventually i will die</e3>, so <e4>it matters not whether i was happy or sad during my life</e4>."

i'm already on 40 mg of celexa and i'm still horribly depressed and anxious. i'd hate to go higher but idk what else to do. i went a year without meds and it completely fucked me up. it was a pretty traumatic experience. i wish i never got on meds in the first place. they made my problems worse. <e1>the year i went without them did a lot of damage that i'll never recover from</e1>. both physical and emotional. it was hell. i know that antidepressants fuck you up but idk if i should <e2>raise my dosage</e2> or not. i mean i'm pretty <e3>set on suicide</e3> so might as well i guess.

"a little over a month ago my girlfriend passed away. she took her own life, and tonight i have been thinking about it in a new way. i don't really believe in anything after death, and i don't think i ever will which has made this extremely hard. the part that is worrying me is i feel as if i'm willing to gamble it, and go out the same way in the same spot, because who knows, maybe i will see her again. i'm 99.9% on the side of there being nothing, but i miss her, and i would so gladly risk getting that .1% to get to be with her. worst case scenario, i'll be gone just like she is. i don't think it's something i'll do, but since i thought about this tonight, i feel i should be open about it. i know it is stupid, and i know i should get real help for this, but i am not going to and i never will."

"i miss when i had people, irl or online, to talk to. i <e1>can't bring myself to talk to new people</e1>, i used to be so much more playful and happy. now i just feel boring, like i have nothing to offer to others. <e2>i've been hurt in the past and i don't want to go through that again</e2>. what if they don't like me? they have their own friends and people to talk to. they don't need me. i don't want them to talk to me out of pity. i don't know how to act like myself. should i just stop overthinking and force myself to talk to others even if it makes me so uncomfortable? hate going to bed feeling so unfulfilled. i want people to care about."

"i was an outcast in highschool. recently i have discovered with a therapist that my world-view at the time was just a coping mechanism. i believed wholeheartedly that i was like a main character in a movie and i was going to end up with the guy who was my first true love and get a happy ending. that didn't happen. i also convinced myself that one day i would be scouted by a record label and would sign a record deal propelling me to stardom and all the popular girls at school would become jealous of me. that didn't happen. instead i lived an average ass life and never got my moment in the spotlight and ended up with boyfriends that always liked me first and i just eventually agreed to start a relationship with. it wasn't the amazing moment i was longing for. now i'm getting older and main characters in movies are getting younger and younger. i can't use this dream to help me cope with life anymore. the curtain has been pulled back, now i see life for the truly depressing meaningless thing it is. and this whole time i was just using a coping mode to distract myself from that grim reality."
i've always been depressed throughout my life but now i've <e1>had a family death and a breakup at the same time</e1>. <e2>i've never felt so empty/angry/sad/alone ever</e2>.

"everyday i wake up with so many things to do and i try my best to do everything but i just can't do it all. the people around me tell me that they are confused why i feel the need to do everything. the answer is simple, if i dont do it then i know it won't be done for a couple of days.i try to do so much and all i'm left with is the idea that nothing i do is good. i like gardening, painting, baking and studying but i'm not good at any of it, i havent been in years. i'm really overweight, ugly, live in the shadow of my older sister, not fluent in my mother language, not funny enough to be considered funny, not smart enough to be considered funny, and just not enough entirely.i try to think differently but every one proves these thoughts. i'm no one's bestfriend, i'm not the favorite daughter, not the favorite niece, never been anyone's girlfriend or crush. the people who did have a crush on me would then change their minds when they got to know the real me.i feel so alone and i'm always sad but no one knows how i feel. if i bring any of this to my friends they are just uncomfortable with these topics. my older sister and my family has always judged me for showing any emotion, even if it's just plain happiness.i dont know what kind of advice i could receive but can someone please give some. i'm really sorry"

"actually i am an ugly guy, and i feel bad for myself a lot. my biggest problem is that i think about what others will think about me. i have a girlfriend and she is very beautiful. i think a lot that people might think bad about me bcoz of my looks. i feel like when my girlfriend is with me outside, what people would think about her that why did she chose such an ugly guy. i have talked about this many times with my girlfriend and she said that she <e1>loves me bcoz of what i am</e1> and she <e2>don't care about my looks</e2>. she tried to make me understand this thing many times. but now she <e3>feels frustrated</e3> bcoz she's <e4>been trying hard but i am not understanding this thing</e4>. like i get her point but after few days same thing comes in my mind. i don't think how should i overcome this and stop thinking about what others think about me. i feel to just suicide. pls help me...."

"i lost in a video game and i literally cried my ass off thinking how useless of a freaking scum i am in life that no one likes and i will never succeed. this happened multiple times before i decided to type this here.i'm extremely disappointed in myself whenever i lost in video games because all i hear in my mind is ""not enough"" ""piece of crap"" ""go kill yourself"". what why how, i got no idea why i could make such a leisure activity into a mental torture.i doubt myself having depression, to me it's just an excuse for being a complete crybaby and blame everyone and everything for my own fault. whenever i hear compliments from people, i would just automatically assume they pity me because i simply don't believe i am that good at something, i got lucky and people saw it.regardless if you give a crap or not (because this is such a generic case of someone failing to keep there crap together), i share to vent and i'll probably go back and disappoint myself even more."

"am i selfish? i'm happy for these people but as soon as they get a leg up in life there's a large part of me that wants to see then fall back into that pit.i think i get <e1>jealous</e1> because it seems to come <e2>so easily to some people</e2>, be it getting an so, a new job, a bonus at work whatever. i just feel better when others feel like i do. it's almost like i feed of of their hopelessness but at the same time i <e3>want to help them feel better</e3> because i <e4>get how it feels</e4>. it's such a weird catch 22 and it really <e5>annoys</e5> me because it makes me feel like i'm <e6>being manipulative</e6>. anyone else get like this??"

"so today i was <e1>feeling bad</e1>, and <e2>slept in</e2>. i woke up at noon and i checked my phone. i had like calls and messages from my friends, worried about me and thought i had hurt myself. i dunno i guess just a funny story, hope everyone is doing well."

"ill have moments where i start to feel like my old self, ill feel like im in control of my mind and mood, but then old thinking patterns caused by certain triggers seem to instantly erase all of the internal progression.how do i come back from this?"

"i have two depression teeth. i'm not nearly as depressed as i was seven years ago when this all started, but i am still pretty anxious. i broke my femur in a head-on colision in 2016, which was <e1>incredibly traumatizing</e2>, and am <e2>now very afraid of being in pain and surgery</e2>.i needed a root canal 7 years ago, and got one with my state's insurance. that's a two part operation. they take the crown off and drill a hole in the first operation, and put the crown on in the second.i got the first part, never got the second because i was suicidal for quite some time, then lost my insurance later on.i now have a bowl tooth that is starting to rot. the rot is spreading to the other tooth. it's constantly in pain. i also have all my wisdom teeth, and they're impacted.i'm terrified of surgery, and i'm <e3>mad that i have to do this</e3> because i let it <e4>get this far</e4>. i'm an adult and i'm genuinely afraid of surgery, healing and being in extended amounts of pain. this whole situation is embarrassing.i'm getting dental insurance tomorrow.anyone else have depression teeth?"

"i never really understood where the happy feelings came from once someone decided to kill themself.right now i'm drunk though, and the thought that i'll kill myself eventually is making me smile.i'll finally be free. i'll finally be able to leave the pain behind. i want that so badly. <e1>it'll be so good</e1>. i <e2>won't have to force myself to socialize</e2>. i <e3>won't have to be awake for all my time alone</e3>.i'll be gone and everyone else will live their lives and it'll be so good.the day i kill myself is something to live for."
